intro: Packera newcombei, commonly known as Newcomb's fleabane, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist meadows, stream banks, and rocky slopes, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its yellow flowers bloom in late summer. Packera newcombei plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in ecologically diverse habitats.
